function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Spread of covid-19 due to reduced traffic flow and movement restrictions","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Global crises triggered by covid-19","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of water, food, and poor health conditions","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fragile health security capacities leading to ineffective handling of covid-19","category":"Family","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neglect of public health challenges in developing countries due to inward focus of developed economies","category":"Family","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Delay in the implementation of the sustainable development goals sdgs due to socio-economic pressures and set-backs","category":"Visitors","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uneven responses and equivocal commitments to change","category":"Participation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effective vaccine","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of the virus due to resistance to shut down economic activity","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Division between cautious and aggressive approaches to economic activity","category":"Business","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Resistance to taking action against climate change","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Divergent national positions undermining international solidarity in fighting covid-19","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shutdown of economies leading to reduction in co2 emissions but rise in waste","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of international solidarity in addressing covid-19 and the sdgs","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fractured state of global health diplomacy","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential reduction in political systems","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Nationalism and populism fueling disunity","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of global coordination and collaboration","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fueling populism and nationalism via patriotism","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Allocation of relief funds to projects not directly related to the epidemic","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Long-lasting economic impacts on developing nations","category":"Business","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited food supplies due to poverty and unemployment","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced access to healthcare due to underinvestment and lack of resilience","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disproportionate impact on the poor and vulnerable","category":"Family","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exacerbation of gender inequality due to the impact of the pandemic on women and isolation","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pandemics like the coronavirus disease can lead to significant psychological impact, exacerbated by socio-economic inequalities and
